critically_acclaimed_documentary.title: Critically Acclaimed Documentary
critically_acclaimed_documentary.description: True life stories that demanded attention and dazzled the critics

15602.title: Boogie Man: The Lee Atwater Story
15602.description: This documentary from director Stefan Forbes examines the political and personal life of the late Lee Atwater, notorious for his no-holds-barred strategies that powered the campaign of George H.W. Bush. Forbes analyzes Atwater's pivotal role in the rise of the Republican Party in the 1980s, and also documents a decidedly less partisan side of the strategist, including his passion for playing the blues.

15614.title: Cropsey
15614.description: Two documentary filmmakers are haunted by a real-life urban legend of the boogeyman, who may be responsible for the disappearances of five children.

22269.title: Sister Helen
22269.description: Brash, foul-mouthed, and no-nonsense, Sister Helen is a recovering alcoholic who lost her husband and sons to substance abuse. She single-handedly fights her own war on drugs as director of a halfway house for recovering addicts in NYC's South Bronx.

22270.title: Strange Culture
22270.description: In this moving and wildly innovative film, director Lynn Hershman Leeson tells the terrifying true story of how one man's personal tragedy turns into persecution by a paranoid and overzealous government.

38613.title: Alamar
38613.description: Winner - Rotterdam Int'l Film Festival. A boy embarks on a farewell voyage with his native father to the gorgeous Mexican coast for an epic adventure.

54909.title: The Revisionaries
54909.description: Creationist Don McLeroy fights to change the standards of US education to his liking through reelection to the Texas State Board of Education.

57193.title: Genius Within: The Inner Life of Glenn Gould
57193.description: Two filmmakers trace legendary pianist Glenn Gould from his childhood to his international triumphs, peering beyond his eccentric image.

136718.title: Bidder 70
136718.description: In 2008, as George W. Bush tried to gift the energy and mining industries thousands of acres of pristine Utah wilderness, college student Tim DeChristopher decided to monkey-wrench the process, igniting the climate justice movement.

136720.title: Chely Wright: Wish Me Away
136720.description: A personal and intimate look at Chely Wright, the first country music star to come out as openly gay. The film charts her pursuit to stardom, her emotional unraveling and eventual rebirth.

257206.title: Festival Express
257206.description: In the summer of 1970, several of the eras biggest rock stars took to the rails for Festival Express. The show was a multi-artist, multi-city concert tour that captured the spirit and imagination of a generation.

268902.title: My Best Fiend
268902.description: Herzog traces the often violent ups and downs of his relationship with actor Klaus Kinski, revisiting the various locations of their films and talking to the people they worked with.

269894.title: Little Dieter Needs To Fly
269894.description: Werner Herzog directs this award-winning documentary about German-American Dieter Dengler, which inspired his later film Rescue Dawn. Here the American naval pilot shares his experience escaping from a POW camp in the Vietnam War.

294107.title: Romantico
294107.description: Mark Becker's Romntico evolves from a verite view of undocumented alien subculture to a deeply personal, subtly-hued, and bittersweet dramatic story of family, fatherhood, identity and survival.

300173.title: Pumping Iron
300173.description: Arnold Schwarzenegger and Lou Ferrigno face off in a no-holds-barred competition for the title of Mr. Olympia in this critically-acclaimed film.

306385.title: Something From Nothing: The Art of Rap
306385.description: In this inspiring documentary, rapper Ice-T travels around the U.S. to interview a diverse group of rappers about their creative process.

310493.title: Air Guitar Nation
310493.description: The guitars may be fake, but the competition is real as legions of aspiring mock stars head to the U.S. Air Guitar Championships in this colorful doc.

312524.title: The World Before Her
312524.description: Two young women find themselves on divergent paths in modern India - one wants to model, and the other is a radical ready to kill for her beliefs.

312526.title: Vivan Las Antipodas!
312526.description: Turn your view of the world upside down as we journey the globe to four antipodal pairs: two places located diametrically opposite on the earth's surface.

312537.title: Hell and Back Again
312537.description: Photojournalist Danfung Dennis reveals the devastating impact a Taliban bullet has on the life of 25-year-old U.S. Marine Sergeant Nathan Harris.

312544.title: The Loving Story
312544.description: A racially charged trial and a heartrending love story converge in this documentary about Mildred and Richard Loving, set during the Civil Rights era.

312548.title: The Last Mountain
312548.description: A rowdy band of citizens tries to stop a giant coal company from blowing up a pristine Appalachian mountain in this consciousness-raising film.

312555.title: Let's Get Lost
312555.description: Traveling with Chet Baker in what became the last year of his life, filmmaker Bruce Weber weaves together the life story of the elusive jazz musician.

312576.title: A Small Act
312576.description: Years after an act of kindness changed his life, a Harvard grad from rural Kenya tracks down the Swedish stranger who sponsored his education.

314069.title: The Rape of Europa
314069.description: In a journey through seven countries, this film explores the violent whirlwind of Nazism that threatened to wipe out the artistic heritage of Europe.

317304.title: Our Nixon
317304.description: Newly uncovered Super 8 home movies filmed by Richard Nixon's closest aides  and fellow Watergate conspirators  offer an intimate and surprising new glimpse into his presidency.

318032.title: The Decline of Western Civilization
318032.description: Penelope Spheeris' The Decline Of Western Civilization is a riveting, unflinching and hard-core film which adeptly captures the spirit of a major cultural phenomenon. Including performances by X, Circle Jerks, Black Flag, Catholic Discipline, Germs and Alice Bag Band. Breaking down barriers of expression and social mores, the Decline punks were against everything: They gave birth to an anti-establishment view of the world that permeates today's music, politics, social attitudes, styles and trends. The film documents their deliberate reaction to the mass commercialism of music; it is a blatant and angry rejection of the mainstream. Burgeoning at the time, many of the punk bands first seen here have become legendary. The effect of the film on current day music, styles and trends is immeasurable.

318034.title: The Decline of Western Civilization Part III
318034.description: The Decline of Western Civilization III is a 1998 documentary film that follows the gutter punk lifestyle of homeless teenagers.

319922.title: Southern Comfort
319922.description: Southern Comfort documents the final year in the life of Robert Eads, a female-to-male transsexual. Eads, diagnosed with ovarian cancer, was turned down for treatment by two dozen doctors out of fear that treating such a patient would hurt their reputations. By the time Eads received treatment, the cancer was too advanced to save his life. Filmmaker Kate Davis follows Robert and a group of trans-gendered Southerners in this captivating and truly touching documentary.

321564.title: Pussy Riot: A Punk Prayer
321564.description: Filmed over six months, this documentary follows Russian punk-activist band Pussy Riot, through their controversial arrest and the resulting fallout.

321995.title: 5 Broken Cameras
321995.description: A documentary on a Palestinian farmer's chronicle of his nonviolent resistance to the actions of the Israeli army via recording it all on video.

324964.title: Sound City
324964.description: Foo Fighters frontman Dave Grohl explores the history of the fabled California recording studio through the memories of the artists who worked there.

337826.title: Call Me Kuchu
337826.description: In an unmarked office at the end of a dirt track, veteran activist David Kato labors to repeal Uganda’s homophobic laws and liberate his fellow lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender men and women, or “kuchus.” But David’s formidable task just became more difficult. A new “Anti-Homosexuality Bill” proposes death for HIV-positive gay men, and prison for anyone who fails to turn in a known homosexual. Inspired by American evangelicals who have christened Uganda ground zero in their war on the “homosexual agenda,” the bill awaits debate in Uganda’s Parliament. Meanwhile, local newspapers have begun outing kuchus with vicious fervor. David, Uganda’s first openly gay man, is one of few who dare to publicly protest state-sanctioned homophobia. Working with an idiosyncratic clan of fellow activists, including retired Anglican Bishop Christopher Senyonjo, David fights Uganda’s government and tabloids in the courts, on television, and at the United Nations. Because, he insists, “if we keep on hiding, they will say we’re not here.”  But no one is prepared for the brutal murder that shakes the movement to its core and sends shock waves around the world. Call Me Kuchu depicts the last year in the life of a courageous, quick-witted and steadfast man whose wisdom and achievements were not fully recognized until after his death, and whose memory has inspired a new generation of human rights advocates.

349386.title: Wild Combination: A Portrait of Arthur Russell
349386.description: Director Matt Wolf's critically acclaimed documentary examines the life and work of Arthur Russell, an influential singer, songwriter, cello player and disco auteur who died tragically in 1992. The film blends archival footage with illuminating interview segments featuring some of Russell's colleagues and most notable collaborators, including poet Allen Ginsberg, composer Philip Glass and indie pop sensation Jens Lekman.

356528.title: Bowling for Columbine
356528.description: This documentary examines gun violence in the U.S. in relation to other countries, including the specific events that led to the Columbine massacre.

376132.title: Deliver Us From Evil
376132.description: This chilling documentary profiles an Irish priest who raped and molested dozens of children over twenty years, all covered up by the Catholic Church.

377076.title: Remote Area Medical
377076.description: During the U.S. debate about healthcare reform, the media reporters and news crews and filmmakers failed to put a human face on what it means to not have access to healthcare. Remote Area Medical fills that gap; it is a film about people, not policy. Focusing on a single three-day clinic held in the Bristol Motor Speedway in Tennessee, Remote Area Medical affords us an insider's perspective on the ebb and flow of the event, from the tense 3:30 a.m. ticket distribution that determines who gets seen to the routine check-ups that take dramatic turns for the worse, to the risky means to which some patients resort for pain relief. We meet a doctor who also drives an 18-wheeler, a denture maker who moonlights as a jeweler, and the organization's founder, Stan Brock, who first imagined Remote Area Medical while living as a cowboy in the Amazon rainforest, hundreds of miles from the nearest doctor. But it is the extraordinary stories of the patients, desperate for medical attention, that create a lasting impression about the state of modern health care in America.

380826.title: The Babushkas of Chernobyl
380826.description: In the Chernobyl 'Dead Zone' or 'Exclusion Zone,' the film's central characters - Hanna Zavorotnya (80), Valentyna Ivanivna (72), and Maria Shovkuta (85) - are the last survivors of a community of 'self settlers' who refused to leave their ancestral homes after the Chernobyl nuclear disaster in 1986. 'Shoot me and dig the grave,' Hanna told a soldier who tried to evacuate her, 'otherwise I'm staying.' She'd survived Stalin's famines and Nazi atrocities on her motherland - she wasn't going to flee an 'invisible enemy.' Over the course of a year, the film follows the women's journeys, and those of visitors, including: the chief of an environmental testing team, a postal worker making her rounds, a 23-year-old female Chernobyl official, a science journalist, and a group of toxic thrill-seekers called 'Stalkers' who break into the Zone illegally for radiation thrills. The film captures extraordinary locations and moments, from radiation spikes just feet from 'the sarcophagus' of nuclear reactor No. 4, to the Zone's sole remaining religious ceremony - Easter midnight mass in the decrepit Chernobyl church. The film's characters and observational style reveal seemingly conflicting layers of a complicated story: Chernobyl is the ancestral home of a community with deep and old roots but the contaminants will survive far longer than the region's culture; the Zone is toxic, yet full of life; the story is steeped a patriarchal post-Soviet environment, yet is rife with powerful 'grandmothers'. How do all of these realities live together?

382999.title: Being Evel
382999.description: This documentary chronicles the life of the renowned daredevil, Evel Kneivel, from his career as a stunt performer to his impact on the world.

383001.title: Olympic Pride, American Prejudice
383001.description: In 1936, 18 African American athletes, dubbed the "black auxillary" by Hitler, participated in the Berlin Olympic Games, defying Nazi Aryan Supremacy and Jim Crow Racism, history forgot all except one. This is the story of the other 17.

384479.title: Power Trip
384479.description: AES Corp., the massive American "global power company," has purchased the privatized electricity distribution company in Tbilisi, capital of the former Soviet Republic of Georgia. AES manager Piers Lewis must now train the formerly communist populace that, in this new world, customers pay for their electricity. The Georgians meanwhile, from pensioners to the Energy Minister, devise ever more clever ways to get it free.  Amidst hot tempers and high drama, Lewis balances his love for the Georgian people with the hardships his company creates for them, as they struggle to build a nation from the rubble of Soviet collapse.

385362.title: The Anthropologist
385362.description: THE ANTHROPOLOGIST examines climate change like no other film before. The fate of the planet is considered from the perspective of American teenager Katie Crate. Over the course of five years, she travels alongside her mother Susie, an anthropologist studying the impact of climate change on indigenous communities. Their journey parallels that of renowned anthropologist Margaret Mead, who for decades sought to understand how global change affects remote cultures.

397553.title: The Dog
397553.description: John Wojtowicz took pride in being a pervert. Coming of age in the 1960s, his libido was excessive even by the libertine standards of the era, with multiple wives and lovers, both women and men. In August 1972, he attempted to rob a Brooklyn bank to finance his lover's sex-reassignment surgery. The act resulted in a fourteen-hour hostage situation that was broadcast on TV. Three years later Al Pacino portrayed his crime in Dog Day Afternoon. The film had a profound influence on Wojtowicz (who pronounced his name "Woto-wits"). When he emerged from a 6-year prison term, he was known as "The Dog." Directors Allison Berg and Frank Keraudren began filming The Dog in 2002. Their long-term dedication pays off in this unforgettable portrait capturing all of the subject's complexity: he is, by turns, lovable, maniacal, heroic, and self-destructive. To call him larger than life feels like an understatement. Drawing upon extraordinary archival footage, the film shuffles between the 1970s and the 2000s. We gain a historic perspective on New York's gay liberation movement, in which Wojtowicz played an active role. In later footage, he remains a subversive force, backed by the unconditional love of his mother Terry, whose wit and charm infuse the film. How and why the bank robbery took place is recounted in gripping detail by Wojtowicz and various eyewitnesses.

405407.title: No No: A Dockumentary
405407.description: Explore the controversial life of Dock Ellis, baseball player and civil rights activist, and the only pitcher to throw a no-hitter while high on LSD.

405454.title: The Yes Men
405454.description: Two men perpetrate an elaborate and elegant form of culture jamming that has duped thousands by creating a fake World Trade Organization website as a joke and then running with it.

410640.title: Gideon's Army
410640.description: More than 7 million Americans are in jail, on probation or on parole. With the law providing that the accused have a right to a lawyer, and by implication a day in court, the United States criminal justice is struggling to keep up. A key component of the American Justice system is the defense lawyer, a right granted in the 1963 Supreme Court Decision Gideon v. Wainwright.

441470.title: Super Size Me
441470.description: Documentarian Morgan Spurlock explores the consequences on his health of a one-month diet consisting solely of items from the McDonald's menu.

449109.title: Milius
449109.description: The life story of controversial film director John Milius. Featuring interviews with Steven Spielberg, George Lucas, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Francis Ford Coppola, Kathleen Kennedy, Harrison Ford, Robert Zemeckis, Oliver Stone and many more.

449116.title: Queen of Ireland
449116.description: The Queen of Ireland follows drag queen Panti Bliss, created by Rory O'Neill. Since the Pantigate scandal in 2014, Panti has become a figurehead for LGBT rights in Ireland and her fight for equality has become recognised across the world.

449534.title: Southwest of Salem: The Story of the San Antonio Four
449534.description: Four Latina lesbians, wrongfully convicted of gang-raping two young girls, challenge convictions on outdated evidence for the first time in the U.S.

452481.title: The Imposter
452481.description: A documentary centered on a young man in Spain who claims to a grieving Texas family that he is their 16-year-old son who has been missing for 3 years.

452736.title: For Ahkeem
452736.description: An intimate look at one black teenager's life and the struggles she faces while demonstrating the strength and courage it takes to survive.

453660.title: Bigger, Stronger, Faster
453660.description: This documentary explores steroid use among America's biggest athletes, and what it says about the culture and future of sports.

453786.title: Fresh Dressed
453786.description: Fashion, music and cultural changes collide in this enlightening documentary, and the legendary artists who've seen it all share their stories.

454010.title: The Island President
454010.description: The president of the Maldives, who brought democracy to his nation, the lowest-lying land on earth, fights to keep it from being swallowed by the sea.

454013.title: Diana Vreeland: The Eye Has to Travel
454013.description: Movie stars, famous photographers, and other celebrities help tell the story of the iconic and influential fashion editor of Harpers Bazaar.

455460.title: The Other Side
455460.description: In a wounded community at the margins of society, drug addicts are searching for escape, and ex-soldiers are still at war with the world.

455462.title: The War Show
455462.description: A radio DJ gives a firsthand account the Syrian civil war, from the euphoria of Arab Spring protests to the depths of despair in the face of violence.

455953.title: Rich Hill
455953.description: Three Midwestern teenagers wrestle with family problems and small-town poverty, clinging to the hope that the American dream is still alive.

456245.title: War Don Don
456245.description: Some call Issa Sesay a war criminal, while others say the rebel leader protected civilians in Sierra Leone. In this trial, nothing is clear.

458241.title: Political Animals
458241.description: Four openly gay lawmakers in California, all of them women, took the fight for equality from the streets and into the halls of government.

458500.title: Mom and Me
458500.description: An Oklahoma radio host opens the lines for men to talk about their mothers, who prove to be just as strong and complicated as the men they raised.

461858.title: No End in Sight
461858.description: An insider's view of the Iraq War, this documentary chronicles the Bush administration's flawed decisions, and how they led to disaster on the ground.

462800.title: Enron: the Smartest Guys in the Room
462800.description: The rise and fall of Enron is the focus as executives got rich pretending the company was more profitable while lower-level employees lost everything.

463016.title: Life Itself
463016.description: This documentary explores the life and legacy of film critic Roger Ebert, who rose to become one of the most influential voices in American culture.

465487.title: Citizenfour
465487.description: History unfolds in real time as Edward Snowden, holed up in a Hong Kong hotel room, blows the whistle on a secret government surveillance program.

466213.title: Keep On Keepin' On
466213.description: At 89, jazz legend and trumpeter Clark Terry takes a young, blind, stage-shy piano prodigy under his wing and prepares him for an elite competition.

473977.title: Hype!
473977.description: This documentary chronicles the frenzy surrounding "grunge music" in the 1990s, as Seattle's underground music scene exploded into the mainstream.

475444.title: Motherland
475444.description: Heart-tugging documentary with a front and center view of one of the world’s busiest maternity hospitals and the mothers’ challenges and stories.

475477.title: The Good Postman
475477.description: A small Bulgarian village is in a crisis of undocumented asylum seekers, heightened by a postman who runs for mayor with a plan to welcome refugees.

475569.title: Best Worst Movie
475569.description: An actor from one of the most notorious duds in film history interviews cast, crew and fans about the movie's long-lasting cult appeal.

476913.title: Nas: Time Is Illmatic
476913.description: Music icons chime in, as rapper Nas recalls his early life in city housing projects, his parents, and the formation of his groundbreaking debut album.

479036.title: An Honest Liar
479036.description: The true story of famed magician “The Amazing Randi” traces his path from illusionist to exposer of fake psychics and those who claim special powers.

479185.title: Family Portrait in Black and White
479185.description: This portrait of a Ukrainian foster mother raising sixteen black orphans explores the racism directed toward people of color in Eastern Europe.

480257.title: Mayor of the Sunset Strip
480257.description: Rodney Bingenheimer has witnessed rock go from glitter to grunge. He’s worn many hats and known many famous faces. This is his incredible story.

485309.title: Letter From Masanjia
485309.description: A barbaric Chinese labor camp is exposed when an American woman finds an SOS letter stashed by a prisoner in a box of Halloween decorations.

489087.title: Angry Inuk
489087.description: An Inuk filmmaker examines seal hunting in the lives of the Inuit, the importance of the trade, and the heavy backlash against it.

490081.title: Older Than Ireland
490081.description: 30 Irish citizens, all 100 or more years old, share their life journeys as well as the personal, political and technological changes in Ireland.

491366.title: Booker's Place: A Mississippi Story
491366.description: A look at how a black man, who voiced ardent opinions about race relations in the 1960s American South on network TV, suffered extreme consequences.

492090.title: The Seventh Fire
492090.description: Executive producers Natalie Portman and Terrence Malick present a haunting documentary about criminal redemption and regret in a Native American gang.

494909.title: Peace Officer
494909.description: After establishing the first SWAT team, which later killed his own son-in-law, a former sheriff exposes the militarized state of American police.

494923.title: California Typewriter
494923.description: In our digital age, see the artists, writers, creatives and collectors still clinging to this outmoded and inconvenient but beloved technology.

495032.title: Tickling Giants
495032.description: A satirist and comedian hosts a wildly popular talk show in Egypt. While enduring political and religious pressure, he uses humor to push for change.

498153.title: Evolution of a Criminal
498153.description: Filmmaker Darius Monroe reflects on the bank robbery he committed as a 16-year-old, with interviews, re-enactments, and raw footage.

499305.title: Jiro Dreams of Sushi
499305.description: Hidden in a Tokyo subway station is a world-renowned sushi restaurant and a master chef whose culinary skills draw visitors from around the globe.

499511.title: Man on Wire
499511.description: Philippe Petit, who walked an illegally rigged highwire between NYC’s twin towers in 1974, faces stupendous challenges for the sake of his daring art.

499633.title: The Agronomist
499633.description: A profile of radio journalist and human rights activist Jean Dominique includes footage of Haiti’s vivid, tumultuous past and exclusive interviews.

499637.title: Murderball
499637.description: Quadriplegics, who play full-contact rugby in wheelchairs, overcome unimaginable obstacles to compete in the Paralympic Games in Athens, Greece.

499678.title: The Trials of Darryl Hunt
499678.description: Darryl Hunt spent nearly twenty years in prison for a brutal rape/murder that he didn't commit. This doc examines social justice through two decades.

499808.title: I Am Thor
499808.description: A decade into retirement, theatrical rock band THOR returns to finally achieve gold-record status, nearly killing its frontman in the process.

501519.title: Don't Think I've Forgotten: Cambodia's Lost Rock and Roll
501519.description: Tragic and uplifting history of Cambodia’s pop music stars from the ‘50s through the ‘70s before the brutal 4-year Khmer Rouge regime in Phnom Penh.

504713.title: Terror's Advocate
504713.description: This doc uncovers the truth about Jacques Vergès, the controversial lawyer who defended Nazi war criminal Klaus Barbie among others.

504942.title: Becoming Bulletproof
504942.description: A documentary about actors with and without disabilities who meet every year at a location to film scripted original films with diversity and skill.

505009.title: Casino Jack and the United States of Money
505009.description: A look into the life of super lobbyist Jack Abramoff, who has had dealings with casinos, Russian spies, Chinese sweatshops, and more.

505013.title: Presenting Princess Shaw
505013.description: An inspiring music doc that follows an unknown New Orleans musician who made it big through a viral collaboration with YouTube artist Kutiman.

505072.title: Breaking a Monster
505072.description: Three Brooklyn 13-year-olds enjoy the early success of their heavy metal/speed punk band as they close a $1.8 million record contract.

505260.title: Ukraine Is Not a Brothel
505260.description: Meet Femen, a Ukrainian feminist who uses topless protests to bring attention to women being marketed as either brides or sex industry objects.

506018.title: 40 Years in the Making: The Magic Music Movie
506018.description: A band named Magic Music lead the way of the Boulder Revolution, until they broke up in 1975. Four decades later, they reunite for fans.

506249.title: Taxi to the Dark Side
506249.description: Torture and interrogation practices used by the United States during the War in Afghanistan are explored in this acclaimed documentary.

506267.title: Born Into Brothels: Calcutta's Red Light Kids
506267.description: This Oscar-winning documentary follows the children of prostitutes in Calcutta, as they learn how photography can help tell their stories.

508307.title: A Skin So Soft
508307.description: Six men, modern-day gladiators by way of their muscular physiques, become obsessed with diet and beating their limitations for the next competition.

510689.title: Score: A Film Music Documentary
510689.description: Film music’s most celebrated names offer a candid look into how composers have developed some of the most iconic scores in the history of cinema.

512246.title: After Tiller
512246.description: After Tiller intimately explores the highly controversial subject of third-trimester abortions in the wake of the 2009 assassination of practitioner Dr. George Tiller. The procedure is now performed by only four doctors in the United States, all former colleagues of Dr. Tiller, who risk their lives every day in the name of their unwavering commitment toward their patients. Directors Martha Shane and Lana Wilson have created a moving and unique exploration of one of the most incendiary topics of our time, and they've done so in an informative, thought-provoking, and compassionate way.

512248.title: A Film Unfinished
512248.description: This potent documentary uses a long-lost film reel to illustrate how the Nazis controlled images of Jewish life during World War II. Though the Nazis made a propaganda movie of contented Jews in the Warsaw ghetto, the missing spool exposes the truth. Director Yael Hersonski shows how the imagery was staged to distort historical knowledge and, with the aid of Jewish survivors' testimony, chronicles the horrifying reality of ghetto life.

512378.title: I Am Big Bird: The Caroll Spinney Story
512378.description: A heartwarming portrait of the beloved puppeteer, known as Sesame Street’s Big Bird and Oscar the Grouch, spotlights his remarkable 45-year journey.

512481.title: The Sensitives
512481.description: This film profiles the lonely and debilitating lives of people suffering from extreme hypersensitivity to everyday elements in our modern world.

512483.title: No Man's Land
512483.description: The story of the 40-day occupation of Oregon’s Malheur National Wildlife Refuge in 2016 by militiamen protesting the conviction of local ranchers.

512494.title: Side by Side
512494.description: Featuring interviews with famed directors like James Cameron, David Fincher and David Lynch, Keanu Reeves explores the future of digital cinema.

512565.title: We Are X
512565.description: A look at X Japan, a beloved rock & roll band, who have sold over 30 million singles and albums combined, despite lacking name recognition.

513686.title: Red Obsession
513686.description: An exploration into the obsession for Bordeaux, the holy grail of fine wines, by a booming and voracious Chinese market. Narrated by Russell Crowe.

513755.title: The Whole Gritty City
513755.description: Directors of New Orleans marching bands prepare kids to perform in the Mardi Gras parades and help them survive in their violent, impoverished city.

513792.title: William S. Burroughs: A Man Within
513792.description: This engaging documentary profiles the beat generation legend, whose powerful way with words influenced the countercultural movement.

513805.title: Tchoupitoulas
513805.description: Journey with three adolescent brothers as they explore in New Orleans for one night, encountering artists, musicians, and hustlers.

513809.title: These Birds Walk
513809.description: A runaway boy in Karachi, Pakistan, faces the struggles of many wayward street children, who rely on good samaritans to provide a future.

513826.title: If a Tree Falls: A Story of the Earth Liberation Front
513826.description: An in-depth look at the rise and fall of a radical group of activists that have gone to shocking measures to send a message against deforestation.

515340.title: Food, Inc.
515340.description: Farmers, scientists and health advocates show the harmful effects of how food production and delivery have been approached at the corporate level.

515417.title: Alive and Kicking
515417.description: Meet lively swing dance professionals and enthusiasts, who are passionate about expressing themselves and spreading joy through movement.

516397.title: The Square
516397.description: This Oscar-nominated documentary gets a firsthand look at the Egyptian Revolution, chronicling the fall of two consecutive Egyptian Presidents.

516607.title: Tomorrow
516607.description: Instead of focusing on the negative effects of climate change, this documentary spotlights people suggesting solutions and their actions.

516678.title: Skid Row Marathon
516678.description: Inspiring documentary about a criminal court judge who trains the homeless and troubled residents of L.A.’s Skid Row to run international marathons.

517547.title: Mission Control: The Unsung Heroes of Apollo
517547.description: A look at the Apollo space program team that came from farms and smokestack towns, but achieved the extraordinary feat of putting a man on the moon.

517568.title: The Uncondemned
517568.description: In 1997, a scrappy young group of lawyers and activists at the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda changed the course of judicial history.

518498.title: The Cockettes
518498.description: The rise and fall of a legendary theater troupe, made up of hippies and cross dressers, whose wild performances in San Francisco were must-see events.

518686.title: Gaza
518686.description: A documentary that goes beyond the news headlines to show some of the resilient people living amid constant conflict in the Palestinian city of Gaza.

519010.title: Love, Antosha
519010.description: A portrait of late actor Anton Yelchin explores his highs and lows through his journals, photography, original music, and interviews with colleagues.

519328.title: Bridegroom
519328.description: In 2011, a young man named Tom died in a tragic accident. Because of legalities, his partner Shane lost all claims to him. This is their story.

519358.title: Matt Shepard Is a Friend of Mine
519358.description: Friends, family members and loved ones of Matthew Shepard discuss the positive impact of his life, as well as the aftermath of his tragic murder.

521527.title: The Tillman Story
521527.description: The story of Pat Tillman, who walked away from a multi-million-dollar NFL deal to join the Army and was killed at 27 in Afghanistan by friendly fire.

522579.title: Kon-Tiki
522579.description: Despite a fear of water and inability to swim, a Norwegian explorer and his crew embarked on an epic journey across the Pacific on a balsa wood raft.

523589.title: Mystify: Michael Hutchence
523589.description: After a head injury robs the INXS frontman of his sense of smell and taste, he enters a downward spiral that ends his life on the eve of a world tour.

524400.title: Itzhak
524400.description: A look at the life, challenges, triumphs, and religious heritage of Itzhak Perlman illuminates the world of the legendary violinist and his music.

526477.title: Barbara Rubin and the Exploding NY Underground
526477.description: The unbelievable story of an avant garde filmmaking ingenue and New York underground scenester turned Orthodox Jew who died mysteriously at age 35.

526924.title: Make Believe
526924.description: Engaging documentary about six teens, each with their signature magic tricks, competing for the title of Teen World Champion in Las Vegas.

527805.title: The Royal Road
527805.description: A cinematic essay on Junipero Serra’s Spanish colonization of California and the Mexican American War includes nostalgic cultural reflections from an LGBTQ perspective.

527861.title: Rebirth
527861.description: A documentary that follows the nearly ten-year transformation of five people whose lives were forever altered on September 11, 2001.

527871.title: Dark Days
527871.description: A documentary exploring the surprisingly domestic subterranean world of a homeless community living in a train tunnel beneath New York City.

527922.title: When I Walk
527922.description: A 25-year-old filmmaker copes with a diagnosis of multiple sclerosis by documenting everyday life as the disease takes greater control of his body.

527964.title: The Departure
527964.description: Using his own self-destructive tendencies as a guide, punk rocker-turned-Buddhist Monk, Ittetsu Nemoto, counsels people contemplating suicide.

527968.title: It’s Not Yet Dark
527968.description: Directing using only his eyes to communicate via computer, a 34-year-old filmmaker tells the story of going from Sundance to an ALS diagnosis.

530327.title: Seasons
530327.description: This documentary showcases the wonders of the natural world through the eyes of the incredible creatures that inhabit a vast green forest.

530331.title: Happy People: A Year in the Taiga
530331.description: Visionary documentarian Werner Herzog shows you the beautiful natural landscapes of Siberian Taiga, and the people who inhabit the space.

530645.title: A Tuba to Cuba
530645.description: Follow New Orleans' famed Preservation Hall Jazz Band as they retrace their musical roots from the city of jazz to the shores of Cuba.

532256.title: Antarctica: A Year on Ice
532256.description: A visually stunning view of life in the coldest, darkest place on Earth features the hard, devoted individuals who reside year-round in Antarctica.

532885.title: What She Said: The Art of Pauline Kael
532885.description: The outspoken and popular film critic for ‘The New Yorker’ magazine, Pauline Kael, is showcased for her pioneering work and voice for movie lovers.

537775.title: Antarctica: Ice and Sky
537775.description: The story of how the research of French glaciologist Claude Lorius in Antarctica led the first call to attention to man-made global climate change.

540301.title: She's Beautiful When She's Angry
540301.description: A provocative, witty and historical account of the start of the women’s liberation movement, from the 1960s through the 21st century.

540532.title: Meru
540532.description: Visually stunning and emotionally powerful chronicle of the obsessive drive of 3 climbers set to take on the dangerous Mount Meru in the Himalayas.

541289.title: Making Waves
541289.description: The world’s most renowned directors discuss the role sound design has played in cultivating the emotional center of our favorite films.

541401.title: Waldo on Weed
541401.description: When baby Waldo’s cancer doesn't respond to chemotherapy, a desperate couple turns to alternative therapies and find miraculous results in CBD oil.

545771.title: I Am Divine
545771.description: The complex life of Divine, the gleefully brash muse of director John Waters, who became one of the first drag superstars of the big screen.

547366.title: Life, Animated
547366.description: The inspirational story of a young man, unable to speak as a child, who learned to communicate through the world of classic Disney animated films.

549640.title: Cartel Land
549640.description: A stark look at two Mexican drug cartel hot-spots and the two separate vigilante groups who've taken justice to eradicate crime into their own hands.

550319.title: Ballast
550319.description: Award-winning independent film about personal and family anguish in the Mississippi delta after a man’s suicide changes the lives of three people.

552461.title: I Am the Blues
552461.description: Visit the juke joints of the Mississippi Delta’s legendary Chitlin Circuit to hear performances from some of the biggest names to ever play the blues.

553668.title: Strongman
553668.description: The true story of the only man alive who can bend a penny with his fingers as he discovers that his personal relationships aren't as malleable.

557459.title: Glen Campbell: I'll Be Me
557459.description: A look at the beloved Rhinestone Cowboy’s inspiring Goodbye Tour, which he completed while simultaneously battling Alzheimer's disease.

559439.title: The Bad Kids
559439.description: Devoted teachers go the distance to improve the lives of their struggling students at a Mojave Desert high school in this emotional documentary.

566286.title: Sour Grapes
566286.description: The true swindle of a young man who conned an entire sector when he sold fake vintage wines, just before the 2008 recession, for millions in cash.

568419.title: Bodysong
568419.description: A fascinating span of one human’s life, put together with over 100 years of found cinema footage and a music score by Radiohead’s Jonny Greenwood.

571208.title: The War at Home
571208.description: Oscar-nominated documentary about the increasingly violent Vietnam War protests from 1963 to 1973 and how Madison, Wisconsin became a flashpoint.

579647.title: Fahrenheit 9/11
579647.description: The definitive exposé revealing how and why the Bush Administration manufactured evidence to invade war in Iraq following the 2001 terrorist attacks.

583308.title: The Garden Left Behind
583308.description: In New York City, an undocumented trans woman dancing in a bar for a living begins a steamy affair with a much older family man yearning for escape.

584677.title: The Kill Team
584677.description: After a US soldier witnesses other troops killing Afghan civilians, he begins to fear that the men he's serving with might be the ones to kill him.

584787.title: Darwin
584787.description: Welcome to Death Valley, California where a population of 35 attempts to find meaning in a place without a government, employment or children.

589074.title: Almost Holy
589074.description: The compelling story of Pastor Gennadiy Mokhnenko, who uses unconventional means to offer homeless, drug-addicted Ukrainian children a place to stay.

589309.title: Mountain
589309.description: The breath-taking views from the highest peaks around the world are captured in this visually stunning documentary, which offers a rare perspective.

592374.title: Welcome to Leith
592374.description: This compelling doc follows a small town in North Dakota, where a white supremacist starts to take over and change the entire community.

592431.title: Sidemen: Long Road to Glory
592431.description: Get to know three legendary Muddy Waters and Howlin' Wolf sidemen, who are still highly influential, despite their lack of name recognition.

593498.title: The Cove
593498.description: The Oscar-winning documentary that exposes the shocking cruelty in the mass slaughter of dolphins in a remote cove in Japan that was secret until now.

593664.title: Informant
593664.description: The true story of Brandon Darby, who went from working as a Hurricane Katrina relief organizer to becoming an FBI informant and right-wing activist.

593957.title: 20,000 Days on Earth
593957.description: The acclaimed music documentary of Australian musician Nick Cave through lyrics, dream-like sequences, and a fresh take on the artistic process.

595381.title: The Long Way Home
595381.description: This Oscar-winning documentary examines the conditions for Jewish refugees after World War II, from their aspirations to emigrate to the reality of continued antisemitism. Many Holocaust survivors wished to relocate to the British Palestine but were often detained due to British immigration laws. Their strive to escape poverty and detainment led to the creation of the modern State of Israel.

595464.title: Lake of Fire
595464.description: Best known for American History X, filmmaker Tony Kaye has been working on Lake of Fire for the past fifteen years and has made a film that is unquestionably the definitive work on the subject of abortion.

595898.title: Fifi Howls From Happiness
595898.description: Explore the enigma of provocative artist Bahman Mohassess, the so-called “Persian Picasso,” whose acclaimed paintings and sculptures dominated pre-revolutionary Iran. Irreverent and uncompromising, a gay man in a hostile world, Mohassess had a conflicted relationship with his homeland—revered by elites in the art scene and praised as a national icon, only to be censored later by an oppressive regime.

595900.title: The Overnighters
595900.description: When thousands show up in response to the real-life oil boom in North Dakota, a pastor provides those left unemployed with a place to stay.

599521.title: Making Montgomery Clift
599521.description: Classic film star and queer icon Montgomery Clift’s legacy has long been a story of tragedy and self-destruction. But when his nephew dives into the family archives, a much more complicated picture emerges.

600680.title: Fail State
600680.description: Produced by news icon Dan Rather, this documentary investigates the dark side of the American higher education system, tracing the rise and resurgence of the for-profit college industry.

601195.title: The Waldheim Waltz
601195.description:
A film about truth and lies and how a dishonest man can rise to power.

Ruth Beckermann documents the process of uncovering former UN Secretary General Kurt Waldheim’s wartime past. It shows the swift succession of new allegations by the World Jewish Congress during his Austrian presidential campaign, the denial by the Austrian political class, the outbreak of anti-Semitism and patriotism, which finally led to his election.

Created from international archive material and what Beckermann shot at the time, the film shows that history repeats itself time and time again.

601822.title: Faces Places
601822.description: A feel-good documentary about two artists from different generations who collaborate on a life-size photo project of unassuming villagers in France.

602161.title: Mr. Fish: Cartooning From the Deep End
602161.description: A once-successful, outrageous editorial cartoonist struggles to support his family and maintain his unique, defiant voice in a changing marketplace.

604505.title: The Last of the Unjust
604505.description: "A historic film." - The New Yorker. "A monumental film." - Film Comment                                                                                                                                                                                                              1975. In Rome, Claude Lanzmann filmed a series of interviews with Benjamin Murmelstein, the last President of the Jewish Council in the Theresienstadt ghetto in Czechoslovakia, the only "Elder of the Jews" not to have been killed during the war. A rabbi in Vienna, following the annexation of Austria by Germany in 1938, Murmelstein fought bitterly with Adolf Eichmann, week after week for seven years, managing to help around 121,000 Jews leave the country, and preventing the liquidation of the ghetto. 2012. Claude Lanzmann, at 87 _ without masking anything of the passage of time on men, but showing the incredible permanence of the locations involved _exhumes these interviews shot in Rome, returning to Theresienstadt, the town ñgiven to the Jews by Hitlerî, a so-called model ghetto, but a ghetto of deceit chosen by Adolf Eichmann to dupe the world. We discover the extraordinary personality of Benjamin Murmelstein: a man blessed with a dazzling intelligence and a true courage, which, along with an unrivaled memory, makes him a wonderfully wry, sardonic and authentic storyteller. Through these three periods, from Nisko in Poland to Theresienstadt, and from Vienna to Rome, the film provides an unprecedented insight into the genesis of the Final Solution. It reveals the true face of Eichmann, and exposes without artifice the savage contradictions of the Jewish Councils.

619800.title: Angels in the Dust
619800.description: This documentary follows therapist Marion Cloete and her family, as they move from Johannesburg to provide better lives for South African children.

650996.title: A Spell to Ward Off the Darkness
650996.description: Follows a man’s search for utopia in an Estonian commune, in the Northern Finland wilderness, and as the singer of a Norwegian neo-pagan metal band.

661286.title: On Any Sunday (50th Anniversary Edition)
661286.description: This documentary sets out to change the perception of motorcycle racing. Featuring stars of the sport such as Steve McQueen, a racer in his own right.
